event.title: raised its pandemic alert level to its fifth level on Friday

data.event: The WHO raised its pandemic alert level to its fifth level on Friday, on a scale of one to six, and has said that it is possible a transition to the highest level will be made.

event.title: increased the number of swine flu incidents in their country to 51 on Friday

data.event: The Canadian government increased the number of swine flu incidents in their country to 51 on Friday, with seventeen new cases having been reported throughout the day.

event.title: now has the third highest number of swine flu cases reported

data.event: Canada now has the third highest number of swine flu cases reported by country, following Mexico and the United States.

event.title: returned from Mexico on April 12

data.event: Dr. Brain Evans said a Canadian who returned from Mexico on April 12 infected a pig farm that he worked at.

event.title: case of the swine flu on Friday

data.event: Hong Kong reported its first confirmed case of the swine flu on Friday in a 25-year-old man who had travelled from Mexico through Shanghai.

event.title: say that police officers wearing masks are now

data.event: Media reports say that police officers wearing masks are now guarding the exits of the building.

event.title: sealed off for a week

data.event: Health officials say that the hotel will remain sealed off for a week, and the Tamilflu antiviral drug given to all residents and staff inside.

event.title: now reported

data.event: The infected man is now reported to be in Hong Kong's Princess Margaret Hospital, where he is in stable condition.

event.title: Friday, the government began

data.event: On Friday, the government began a shutdown of the country for five days, in an effort to stop the disease from spreading.

event.title: all its stops at the country's ports until May 11

data.event: Carnival Cruise lines, meanwhile, has cancelled all its stops at the country's ports until May 11.

event.title: all of its visits until May 4

data.event: Previously, the cruise line had suspended all of its visits until May 4.

event.title: were admitted on Thursday

data.event: Jose Angel Cordova said that the number of new cases and hospitalisations from the disease seemed to be slowing down; only 46 persons with severe symptoms of the influenza were admitted on Thursday, less than a fourth of the 212 patients that had been admitted on April 20.

event.title: had been admitted on April 20

event.title: had informed a regional branch of the WHO of a sharp increase in sicknesses on April 16

data.event: Lezana said that his centre had informed a regional branch of the WHO of a sharp increase in sicknesses on April 16, but the WHO had not taken any action for eight days.

event.title: had not taken any action for eight days

data.event: Lezana said that his centre had informed a regional branch of the WHO of a sharp increase in sicknesses on April 16, but the WHO had not taken any action for eight days.

event.title: Friday, the government said

data.event: 136 suspected cases of the influenza have been reported in New Zealand as of Friday, the government said.

event.title: the 25 suspected cases on Thursday

data.event: The number is a sharp increase over the 25 suspected cases on Thursday.

event.title: had arrived from North America on April 19

data.event: Officials stated that a passenger that had arrived from North America on April 19 had tested positive for influenza A, similar to the swine flu virus.

event.title: are involved today

data.event: Julia Peters, the top medical official of Auckland, said that "we are involved today in an extensive contact-tracing exercise with his place of work."

event.title: April 22 and did not seek

data.event: The passenger had arrived on the 19th, but did not start displaying symptoms of the flu until April 22 and did not seek medical help until April 28, when he and his family were placed into a quarantine.

event.title: April 28, when he and his family were placed

data.event: The passenger had arrived on the 19th, but did not start displaying symptoms of the flu until April 22 and did not seek medical help until April 28, when he and his family were placed into a quarantine.

event.title: stated on Tuesday

data.event: John Odey, the Environment Minister of the African country of Nigeria, stated on Tuesday that the government has ordered all ships and aircraft arriving in Nigeria are to be checked and cleaned, in a move to prevent the entrance of the flu into the nation.

event.title: attracts about 200,000 people over four days

data.event: In addition, Fort Worth's annual Mayfest, which attracts about 200,000 people over four days, has been called off.
